BANQUET CHEF       Professional Summary     To whom it may concern: Please accept this letter as my application for the position of executive chef. I am an ambitious and well rounded chef who is able to lead from the front by setting, following and delivering the highest culinary standards. I possess a passion for excellence, and always strive hard to im- prove standards and guest satisfaction. My goal as executive chef is to provide the club members with an experience that exceeds there expectations. I believe that is accomplished by using the highest quality food product keeping within the food budget and assembling the best possible culinary brigade to meet the members needs. I standardize my recipes to maintain consistency and always demonstrate what is ex- pected for each dish concerning portion size, proper cooking techniques, and presentation. My management style is fair, firm, and friendly but with high expectations, also I consider my self to be proactive in running the kitchen. I delegate people according to their strengths, but rotate them seasonally to different stations to help them in their professional development and increas- ing flexibility in the kitchen staff. I train the wait staff on the menu by letting them sample the menu items, and listen to their feed back. I am flexible with special dietary requests from members. I am glad to make adjustments for health conscious members, or those with specific dietary needs. I am visible to the members in the dinning room so that I am able to receive their feed back on the menu. Over the years I had the pleasure of working with some of the best chefs in the country which has enabled me to have a board knowledge of different types of cuisines and keeping up with trends. story:
Let me tell you the story of Marco Lombardini, a passionate culinary professional whose journey in the kitchen spans decades.

Marco's culinary adventure began at Baltimore Culinary College, where he graduated with honors in restaurant and hotel management. His foundation was further strengthened at The Greenbrier Apprenticeship Program, where his talent shone through as he earned a gold medal in cold food display and a silver medal in hot food competition.

In 1990, Marco started as a Sous Chef, managing a impressive team of 100 kitchen personnel in a large hotel operation. During this period, he had the privilege of working alongside some of America's finest chefs, including several Certified Master Chefs who would become his mentors.

A significant chapter in Marco's story began in 1996 when he took the bold step of becoming the owner, executive chef, and general manager of the Candle Light Inn in Catonsville, Maryland. For 17 years, he ran this 200-seat white tablecloth restaurant, leading a team of 50 employees and creating modern traditional cuisine that delighted patrons.

In 2014, Marco took on the role of Executive Sous Chef at a prestigious Platinum Club, where he helped maintain the club's elite status among the top 10 private club communities in the United States. Two years later, he advanced to his current position as Banquet Chef at The Country Club at Mirasol, a three-time Platinum Club of America member. Here, he leads a team of 12, orchestrating banquets and member functions that generate half of the club's $6 million food and beverage revenue.

Throughout his career, Marco has continued to evolve, earning his ACF Executive Certified Chef certification in 2012 and participating in advanced training, including Sous Vide workshops and Certified Master Chef preparation classes under Richard Rosendale, CMC.

Marco's philosophy centers on leadership by example, maintaining high standards, and nurturing talent through rotation and training. He believes in being visible to members, adaptable to their needs, and committed to exceeding expectations through quality ingredients and precise execution.

His story continues as he seeks new opportunities to bring his extensive experience, leadership skills, and culinary passion to new heights in the hospitality industry.
